node.title: Convicted murderers' appeals rejected
node.description: Two people who tortured and murdered 17-year-old rough sleeper Dimetrius Pairama in 2018 have their appeals rejected.

node.title: EV owners warned to plan, charge ahead of using Transmission Gully
node.description: Electric vehicle owners are being warned to top up if heading over Transmission Gully, because the steep road will drain their batteries faster than the old coastal route.

node.title: Telescope discovers record-breaking galactic space laser
node.description: The megamaser, named Nkalakatha, was discovered by the MeerKAT telescope in South Africa.

node.title: Watch live: Dan Carter takes on 24-hour kickathon for charity
node.description: All Black and Crusaders legend Dan Carter attempts a 24-hour kickathon in an effort to raise funds for children across New Zealand and the Pacific. Video

node.title: Superannuation Fund looks to acquire Vodafone cell towers
node.description: The New Zealand Superannuation Fund is among those rumoured to be in the running to snap up Vodafone NZ's cell towers.

node.title: Housing market shifts in favour of buyers - QV
node.description: The QV House Price Index has its largest quarterly drop in more than a decade, as rising interest rates and tighter lending drives down prices in major centres.

node.title: Antarctica postmaster wanted: 'It's a busy role'
node.description: If you just want to get away from it all, this could be the job for you - a new postie is needed on Goudier Island in Antarctica. Audio

node.title: Almond crops being tested for potential New Zealand industry
node.description: The potential for an almond industry in New Zealand is being explored, with a study considering whether almonds can be grown sustainably in Hawke's Bay.

node.title: Minister, NZTA to blame for Clean Car scheme using unreliable data - dealers
node.description: Car dealers are worried they will have to pay the bill for errors in the Clean Car Discount Scheme that could cost buyers hundreds or even thousands of dollars.

node.title: Man dies in hospital after Auckland mall carpark incident
node.description: Manurewa man Gary Cowley has died in hospital after being allegedly hit by a vehicle alongside multiple pedestrians at Westfield Manukau last month.

node.title: SH35 between Tokomaru Bay and Te Puia Springs reopens
node.description: The road, which was extensively damaged by last month's storm, has reopened, but Waka Kotahi warns disruptions to traffic will be ongoing as repairs continue.

node.title: Further charges laid after victim of Westfield crash dies in hospital
node.description: Manurewa man Gary Cowley has died in hospital after being allegedly hit by a vehicle alongside multiple pedestrians at Westfield Manukau last month.

node.title: Builder to stand for Act in Tauranga by-election
node.description: The Act Party has confirmed its candidate to stand in the Tauranga by-election as self-employed builder Cameron Luxton.

node.title: 'Hamstrung': Concern Pacific neighbours profit as NZ maritime border stays shut
node.description: Superyacht agents want the maritime border to re-open so they can secure bookings before some of the world's wealthiest again choose to sail elsewhere next summer.

node.title: Officials seek help solving cold case of 16-year-old who disappeared decades ago
node.description: Detectives identified Fly Creek Jane Doe as Sandra (Sandy) Renee Morden in 2019.

node.title: Govt urged to adapt its approach to secure trade deal with India
node.description: There are calls for the government to follow Australia's example so that it can finalise a free trade deal with India.

node.title: Homicide investigation after man killed in East Auckland
node.description: A homicide investigation has been launched after a man was killed at a house in East Auckland.

node.title: Mahuta remains coy on sending lethal aid to Ukraine military
node.description: Foreign Affairs Minister Nanaia Mahuta has refused to confirm whether or not New Zealand is prepared to provide Ukraine's military with lethal aid. Audio

node.title: Senate candidate Dr. Oz reports at least $100 million in assets
node.description: If elected, he would be one of the wealthiest members of the Senate — and possibly the wealthiest.

node.title: Federal appeals court upholds Biden vaccine rule for all federal employees
node.description: In a 2-1 ruling, a panel of the 5th Circuit Court of Appeals in New Orleans reversed a lower court's ruling and ordered a lawsuit challenging the requirement be dismissed.

node.title: Health system shake-up: Why the overhaul should focus on local communities
node.description: Analysis - With the government set to launch a massive overhaul of the health sector later this year, experts say local communities should be involved in developing the health services that affect…

node.title: Bay of Plenty Covid-19 hospitalisation numbers peak
node.description: Hospitalisations for Covid-19 are peaking across the Bay of Plenty region and the number of people aged over 65 contracting the virus is also rising.

node.title: Atlanta preschool combats teacher shortage by hiring Afghan refugees
node.description: It's a four-month pilot program in which the refugees, who are paid interns, become certified as child care instructors and will qualify for full-time jobs.

node.title: Jogger discovers "alien like creature" with "human" lips on Australian beach
node.description: A man was jogging when he encountered the animal, which had skin like a shark.

node.title: Schools face rise in suicides during pandemic: "So many kids are hurting"
node.description: At least 30 students have died by suicide in a Las Vegas school district since the pandemic began.

node.title: Zelenskyy says situation in Borodyanka is much worse than in Bucha
node.description: Investigators say they found 26 bodies on Thursday.

node.title: Los Angeles woman wins $10 million after pressing wrong lottery button
node.description: The woman plans to use the funds to buy a house and start a non-profit organization.

node.title: So long, Dr Ashley Bloomfield
node.description: The Detail - The Director-General of Health has been a regular in our living rooms over the past two years and has become one of the most recognised faces of the Covid-19 response.

node.title: "Plaza Suite" cancels performances after Sarah Jessica Parker contracts COVID
node.description: Several Broadway shows are having to cancel performances due to the virus.

node.title: As the price of gas soars, some fill up by stealing it
node.description: Thieves are stealing truckloads of fuel from gas stations and reselling it, while others target parked vehicles.
